reviews.text: We stayed here for a week and found the hotel clean, well decorated and comfortable. We had our breakfast in the hotel nearly every morning and found this to be good value for money. We also found the location very good, as the weather wasn't too good we spent a bit of time at the shopping mall which was right next door. Overall we had a good holiday and would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: We all thought this was a lovely well located hotel

reviews.text: We came to the Cape for a wedding in Chatham. We weren't looking for a view or a resort. The Marriott is a perfectly good place to sleep, shower, and change clothes. It's on the commercial strip north of Hyannis, so you've got a Dunkin Donuts across the street, and a few steps that connect the Marriott parking lot with the Cape Cod Mall parking lot. The breakfast buffet was $10/person, and I thought $8 would have been fair ... but I guess that's my biggest complaint. We'd go back.
reviews.title: Reasonably Priced Place to Sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a very loyal Marriott customer. This hotel is fine. Nothing fancy, but clean and very very close to all the places in Hyannis you'd want to go. Even next to a mall. We could have spent more to stay closer to the water, but it's a couple miles to the ports and we got around very quickly.
reviews.title: Gets the job done!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in April 2009, we were a bit disappointed by the design of the property, the exterior really looked like a motel and the room was poorly decorated, the lobby and the breakfast room were more welcoming. But the room was clean and comfortable with large queen beds and a good shower. The pool had no particular charm but a good size, there was no whirlpool bathtub. The breakfast buffet was good with hot items and enough choice. The hotel is located near the Cape Cod Mall on a large road which means that it's neither the most charming nor the most scenic location on the Cape. But in early April the choice of hotels was limited and the Courtyard offered us a good bed for a moderate rate and its location allowed us to easily reach the highlights of the Cape.
reviews.title: Good value for money but lacks of charm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Courtyard is located in the middle of the shopping strip--malls and plazas. It's conveniently located but it's not an attractive part of the Cape. The room was average--clean, a comfortable size, reasonably priced, with a comfortable bed, good-sized TV, and convenient wireless connection available. We were surprised by a couple of things that detracted from its ratings and kept it average. One, the towels were thin. Second, there was limited elevator access to the second floor. There are long corridors and the only elevator to a second floor room is by the front desk, so if someone is disabled or has luggage on wheels, the only useful entrance would be at the front desk and then you would have to walk a long ways. Otherwise, you'll discover (like we did) that parking in the back of the building (closer to our room) required hauling our rolling luggage up a curb by the back door and then up a flight of stairs to a second floor room.
reviews.title: Adequate and clean; nothing to write home about
Good Value - Spotless and Comfortable
reviews.text: Cannot fault other than the location slighly out of town but this was expected and lack of footpaths meant the use of a car was important - this lack of pavement very noticible in America. Anyway the hotel and the room rate including the breakfast was probably the best value during my recent trip - room very comfortable well kitted out microwave fridge etc. Staff polite and helpful, facilities good, room good. Thank you Marriot for an enjoyable stay at a reasonble rate - I think the rate was lower because it included part of the weekend and the breakfast option was only a few dollars more and breakfast was a pleasurable experience good food, excellent choice, attentive and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was an ideal home away from home. We stayed here two nights while using Hyannis as a home base for a day trip to Nantucket. It was well worth the money. The rooms were modern, spacious, and clean. The pool was great.
reviews.title: Quiet, clean hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms were spacious and clean
likes.disliked: — It's not in the most scenic area of Hyannis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another wonderful stay at the Courtyard-Hyannis. As a Marriott's Gold Member, the hotel gave us a spacious room. The omelettes were great for breakfast each morning and the buffet had all we needed. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The bed was wonderful. The location was great from shopping and dining with the mall and surrounded by shopping plazas. The grounds are nice with the lawn and gazebo. The beaches aren't faraway and there are plenty of golf courses. This is our getaway hotel for Cape Cod and we love it. Our only complaints are that the pool doesn't open unyil 9AM and there's isn't a hot tub.
reviews.title: Indian Summer

likes.disliked: — Pool opens late and no hot tub.

reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend in March with the whole family - 6 rooms. Booked the stay for breakfast package for $109 night includes breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children. We had a great time.
reviews.title: Comfortable,pleasant,clean

reviews.text: This is not the hotel for you if looking for Cape Cod beauty. This is in the heart of Hyannis retail road. Sits between the mall and Christmas Tree Shop. Very convenient if you want to shop or go to the cinema. The hotel has a simple, but comfortable and roomy indoor pool. Rooms were large and comfortable and very clean. The breakfast was very good with many choices in a large and comfortable area also excellent waitstaff.
reviews.title: okay, except the fan was incredibly loud

reviews.text: I’ve stayed at the Courtyard Marriott recently. I work in Hyannis and on occasion I stay overnight due to inclement weather, traffic, etc. I can say is the Courtyard is mediocre. It is a business hotel but, so isn't the Holiday Inn and the Hampton Inn down the street. On a scale I would place the Hampton Inn as one of my best stays. The hotel is brand new, new contemporary furnishings and a great breakfast buffet. I would place the Holiday Inn as 2nd as it was newly renovated from a Radisson Hotel although it sure was noisy with paper thin walls and the Courtyard as 3rd. The Courtyard was fairly clean in the public areas as well as my room however, the furniture was dated. Honestly, I've seen the same furniture in the Travelodge down the street in West Yarmouth. I'm a hotel snob. If you’re not I would say "go for it" at the Courtyard. If I have to pay exuberant hotel rates for lodging on Cape Cod whether it is off-season or high-season the furniture and furnishings best be updated or be fairly new for me to be a return customer. Why should I have to tolerate “Golden Girls furnishings” when I can splendor in the fresh new furnishings of your competitors down the street.
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hate to be a downer, but we though this place was just average, nothing special. We immediately had to switch rooms due to the dirty shower tub (hair all over, it was not cleaned at all obviously).
reviews.title: 2 star at best, had to switch rooms for dirty bathtub.
Convenient, clean, helpful staff.
reviews.text: Location wise, we liked it as a homebase to explore Cape Cod.
It's a 2 star hotel, not a 3 star.
reviews.title: Excellent value - great location

reviews.text: We stayed two nights and would loved to stayed longer. Great base location for all we wanted to do. It is a day trip to Provincetown if you take your time and we loved it! Our room was very nice and clean. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice reasonably priced hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I travel frequently for short golf trips (3-4 days); the Cape is one of our favorites spots. This was our first stay at the Courtyard Marriott, and we will be staying here from now on. Despite its location on highway 132, the entire property is nice and quiet. We had a king room with loads of space. Super-comfy bed and pillows (not too hard, not too soft); free wireless internet connection, which is crucial for us when we're away. Breakfast buffet was way better than we usually expect in a hotel this size. The staff was incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. Seriously, nothing negative to say about our stay. (Side note: I especially enjoyed the free 24hour tea/coffee service and fresh, clean spaces everywhere in the hotel)
reviews.title: The best Cape Cod hotel experience we've had

reviews.text: We planned to stay here for the night after we got off the ferry from Nantucket late evening. We had called to confirm our family room booking in the afternoon and were told it was "fine" still.
reviews.title: Avoid, Awful Staff, Car Park thefts prominent.

reviews.text: We arrived tired off the ferry at 10pm, went to the desk, the staff did not look happy to see us and told us they had given our room away. They said they had made a suitable alternative, which we would be happy with. We went and checked this so-called alternative which was two very narrow, uncomfortable pull out beds in a small room. This was not acceptable!! The staff could not care less, they rolled their eyes when we said it was not what we paid for or wanted, and could they offer something else. The only thing they did was give us numbers of another inferior hotel, by this time it was 10.30pm and we did not want to pay for a room somewhere else. The manager did not care, and was very arrogant, and showed no signs of feeling guilty about giving our room away, they also refused to acceot that we had confirmed the room, and even though we noted the girls name who we called, she pretended she never recived the call...surprise surprise!! We had no other option but to stay in the room they had provided, all they offered was a free breakfast the next morning...hardly appeasing!
reviews.title: You will be happy with this hotel!

reviews.text: When we came home my parents contacted Lastminute.com who we booked with and they helped us take this further and months after we recived a full refund for the night, it was not worth the hassel. Also the next morning checking out a fellow customer had had his car broken into in the hotle car park, they would not offer to help at all, and just replied "Oh dear, it happens all the time"!! Hardly an acceptable response. Stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Up to Courtyard standards

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in February when we were searching for a summer rental on the Cape. The rooms are very nice, high quality, clean, and the beds are very comfortable. You really will not be disappointed. Buffet breakfast is served in the hotel restaurant for an extra fee, but it is convenient and good. I was able to get on the internet with my laptop in the evening to research more summer rentals in the area. No problem with the connection.
reviews.title: Clean and quiet

likes.disliked: — Only available conference room that day was pretty small for our needs
